intro: Dubautia scabra, commonly known as the rough dubautia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its grayish, hairy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often found in dry, sunny environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of Hawaii. Dubautia scabra is considered an endemic species, meaning it is found nowhere else in the world.
